events.title: Routine Prison Operations
events.description: Standard prison activities including cell searches, inmate counts, meal service, security checks, and inmate movements (legal visits, work details).

events.title: Inmate Work Detail
events.description: Inmate Wilbert Turner was taken to and returned from a Blood Spatter Team (BST) work detail.

events.title: Shift Change and Counts
events.description: Multiple officer shift changes and inmate counts (base, official, verbal) conducted throughout the day and night.

events.title: Overnight Prison Operations
events.description: Continuation of routine overnight operations including rounds, watch calls, searches, and a sanitation detail.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations
events.description: Standard daily operations at MCC New York housing units including head counts, key checks, radio checks, fire panel checks, inmate feeding, cell searches, and PREA compliance rounds.

events.title: Overnight Prison Operations
events.description: Continuation of routine overnight operations including counts, PREA rounds, and shift changes. Log notes multiple PREA rounds conducted due to a 'portal malfunc' (likely a cell door interlock system issue).

events.title: Routine Prison Operations Log
events.description: Detailed log of standard prison activities at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, including inmate counts, security checks (body alarms, fire panels, keys, OC spray), inmate movements to/from SHU and education, and cell searches.

events.title: Evening Shift Prison Operations
events.description: Routine evening shift activities at MCC New York including inmate counts, cell searches, security checks, meal services, mail call, and staff rounds.

events.title: Inmate Return from Court
events.description: Log entry notes 'INMATE BACK FROM COURT' at 6:52 PM, indicating an inmate returned to the housing unit from a court appearance.

events.title: PREA Rounds Conducted
events.description: Lieutenant TF18990 conducted multiple rounds specifically noted as 'PREA Rds Made', referring to Prison Rape Elimination Act compliance checks.

events.title: Cell Searches (Shake Downs)
events.description: Multiple cell searches ('shake downs') were conducted, resulting in contraband ('NUIS') being found and discarded from cells of specific inmates.

events.title: New Inmate Commitments
events.description: Several new inmates (Newton, Espinal, Jones, Lopez) are logged as new commitments arriving at the MCC New York housing unit.

events.title: Inmate Out to Court
events.description: Inmate Michael Brown is noted as being out to court.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations
events.description: Standard prison operations including inmate counts, officer rounds, security checks, and meal service are conducted throughout the overnight and morning shifts.

events.title: Inmate Release and SHU Placement
events.description: Inmate Tallat Mahmood (ID 24988014) was released from the housing unit, and inmate Omar Santiago-Mendoza (ID 80341083) was removed and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Evening Prison Operations
events.description: Routine prison operations including rounds, watch calls, cell searches, inmate transfers, and PREA checks at MCC New York.

events.title: Morning Prison Operations
events.description: Continuation of routine operations including counts, feeding, inmate transfers, and PREA checks at MCC New York.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Counts
events.description: Log entries detail routine security checks, body alarm checks, fire alarm panel checks, inventory verification, key checks, OC spray checks, radio checks, base counts, rounds, searches of common areas and cells, and watch calls throughout the day and evening shifts at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: PREA Rounds Conducted
events.description: Lieutenant Monge conducted multiple rounds in various housing units (KN, KS, IN, GN, GS, EN, BA) specifically under the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) protocol.

events.title: Morning PREA Rounds
events.description: Morning PREA unit rounds were conducted by a lieutenant, with notes indicating a 'PT/portal malfunction' in several housing units.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Inmate Movement
events.description: A day of standard prison operations at MCC New York, including security checks, counts, meals, and inmate movements in and out of the general population housing units.

events.title: Inmate Moved to SHU for Safety
events.description: Inmate Mark Gouldbourne was checked into the Special Housing Unit (SHU) after stating he did not feel safe on the general population unit. The operations lieutenant was notified.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Inmate Intake
events.description: Logs show standard prison activities including housing unit checks, official inmate counts, PREA compliance rounds, and the intake of five new inmates into the general population.

events.title: Continued Prison Security and Operational Checks
events.description: Logs detail the continuation of standard procedures: shift changes, security checks of common areas (balcony, gym, kitchen), inmate feeding, and multiple PREA compliance rounds conducted by lieutenants.

events.title: PREA Rounds Conducted
events.description: Log entry specifies rounds were conducted with a PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) notation, indicating specific protocol compliance.

events.title: Legal Call for Inmate Latimer
events.description: Inmate Corey Latimer was given a legal call (7:35pm-7:45pm) as per Counselor Elaind.

events.title: Visual Search of Inmate Martin
events.description: A visual search was conducted on inmate Kareem Martin, and the base count was changed to 70.

events.title: Inmate Movements and Count Changes
events.description: Visual searches and changes to the base inmate count were logged for inmates Glenn Thomas (count in 71), Annel Aberhante (count in 72), and Frank Pasqua.

events.title: Missing Equipment Report
events.description: During a morning fire and security check, it was noted that one set of rapid cuffs was missing.

events.title: SHU Cell 4414 Vacant
events.description: Log entry notes that SHU cell 4414 was vacant at the time and had been since the beginning of the shift.

events.title: Inmate Frank Pasqua Moved to SHU
events.description: Inmate Frank Pasqua (18299043) was moved within the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at approximately 9:01 PM, logged as a change to the base count.

events.title: Routine SHU Operations and Inmate Transfers
events.description: A series of routine operational logs for the SHU including security checks, counts, and inmate movements (Roper, Brissett, Peralta, Soto, Ochoa) in and out of the unit for visitation or transfers.

events.title: Inmates Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmates Steven Estevez and Jaquez Hill were placed on suicide watch after each stated they wanted to kill themselves. Their property was moved to the property room.

events.title: Inmate Medical Complaint
events.description: Inmate Howard Davis complained of coughing up blood. Medical services were notified and responded to check on him.

events.title: Inmate Moved to Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Orlando Peralta was moved to the 2nd floor suicide watch.

events.title: Staffing and Operational Notes
events.description: Logs note the unit was on 'downgraded operation and short staffed' during the evening shift.

events.title: Feeding and Staffing Issues
events.description: Logs note a shortage of meal trays and that only two officers were on the unit during the morning feeding, with one (Davis) having to leave at 5 AM due to shift mandate.

events.title: Routine SHU Security Checks and Counts
events.description: Standard prison operations in the Special Housing Unit (9 SOUTH SHU) at MCC New York, including body alarm checks, radio checks, fire alarm checks, key checks, inventory, and searches of common areas (laundry, law library, recreation, staff bathroom, strip rooms).

events.title: Daily Key Count
events.description: Routine inventory and count of all prison keys (Rings A, B, C, D, E, F, G, L, Q, S, V, P) at MCC New York, showing totals and verification.

events.title: MCC New York FY-2019 Annual Training Sessions
events.description: Multiple weeks of scheduled annual training for MCC New York staff, covering ethics, PREA, use of force, firearms, information security, and other correctional topics.

events.title: Firearms Training at FCI Danbury
events.description: Staff from MCC New York traveled to FCI Danbury for annual firearms qualification and certification.

events.title: Firearms Training at FCI Danbury (Second Session)
events.description: A second scheduled session for MCC New York staff to complete annual firearms training at FCI Danbury.
